page.title: 08TOURISM, BONAR BRIDGE
page.content: Years ago{Bonar Bridge}was known as a picturesque holiday resort. Nowadays, we would not really call it a resort but it is a busy place in the summer. Tourists come here as it is a good{centre}from which to{tour}the northern highlands. Many people stay here on their way north or west. Some tourists come for the{salmon fishing on the Kyle and nearby rivers. The village has three{hotels}and many {guest houses}and{bed and breakfast places. Tourism also benefits the local shopkeepers, garages and post-office. The attractive nine-hole {golf course}in Bonar and the proximity of several good full-size courses makes this area an ideal choice for keen golfers.
